trustfund:
TF024939-GEF 2 - PERU : INDIGENOUS
            MANAGEMENT OF PROTECTED AREAS IN THE PERUVIAN,TF021853-GEF PDF BLOCK B: INDIGENOUS
            MGMT OF PROTECTED AREAS IN THE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Indigenous Management of Protected
            Areas in the Peruvian Amazon Project aims to increase the
            sustainability of biodiversity conservation by involving
            indigenous communities in the management of new and existing
            protected areas. There are four project components. The
            first 1) prepares planning documents and the consultative
            process for creating one new protected area and the
            permanent categorization of three existing reserved zones;
            2) establishes protected area management committees; 3)
            creates a community-based and -managed protected area
            surveillance system; 4) trains indigenous community leaders
            in participatory methods; 5) implements a public awareness
            program; 6) builds and refurbishes facilities; 7) involves
            local staff and specialists; and 8) finances office,
            transportation, and communications equipment. The second
            component prepares management plans for titled indigenous
            land; technical studies and demand and market studies; and
            provides biodiversity investment sub-grants. The third
            component establishes a monitoring and evaluation unit at
            the central level and zonal levels and contracts for an
            analysis of the conservation and socioeconomic status of
            project areas and baseline information; develops biological
            and socio-economic databases and a geographical information
            system; prepares monitoring plans; and trains staff and
            local indigenous promoters.
